title: Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS) Diagnostic Criteria
short_description: Clinical document describing diagnostic criteria for ARDS, including respiratory symptoms, blood oxygen levels, and imaging findings.
long_description: This clinical document outlines the diagnostic approach for Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS), detailing the key clinical indicators including respiratory distress, hypoxemia, and associated risk factors such as sepsis, pneumonia, or trauma. The document explains the characteristic chest x-ray findings showing fluid accumulation in alveolar spaces and discusses the differential diagnosis between ARDS and congestive heart failure, emphasizing the importance of thorough medical examination in distinguishing between these conditions.
